unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi has appointed Dr. Chaturvedi as the new Head of the Dept. of Silly Walks. Yes, you read that right! Following the recent controversy where the previous "Director Sahab" was caught moonwalking during a serious cardiology lecture, the hospital decided a change was needed.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi has appointed Doctor Chaturvedi as the new Head of the Department of Silly Walks. Yes, you read that right! Following the recent controversy where the previous "Director Sahab" was caught moonwalking during a serious cardiology lecture, the hospital decided a change was needed.

unnormalised: Dr. Chaturvedi, previously known for his groundbreaking research on the therapeutic effects of the 'Naggin Dance' on lower back pain, beat out fierce competition, including Prof. Sharma, who advocated for the 'Bhangra Bounce' method. Insiders say the selection committee was swayed by Dr. C's infectious enthusiasm, demonstrated by his impromptu demonstration of the 'Pigeon Plod' during the interview.
normalised: Doctor Chaturvedi, previously known for his groundbreaking research on the therapeutic effects of the 'Naggin Dance' on lower back pain, beat out fierce competition, including Professor Sharma, who advocated for the 'Bhangra Bounce' method. Insiders say the selection committee was swayed by Doctor C's infectious enthusiasm, demonstrated by his impromptu demonstration of the 'Pigeon Plod' during the interview.

unnormalised: "We believe," stated a hospital spokesperson (who wished to remain anonymous, probably fearing being forced into a silly walk), "that Dr. C's appointment will bring much-needed levity to the demanding world of healthcare. Plus, let's be honest, watching a bunch of stressed-out doctors attempting the 'Ministry of Silly Walks' is way more entertaining than another PowerPoint presentation on EKG readings!"
normalised: "We believe," stated a hospital spokesperson (who wished to remain anonymous, probably fearing being forced into a silly walk), "that Doctor C's appointment will bring much-needed levity to the demanding world of healthcare. Plus, let's be honest, watching a bunch of stressed-out doctors attempting the 'Ministry of Silly Walks' is way more entertaining than another PowerPoint presentation on E-K-G readings!"

unnormalised: The spokesperson added, "We're also introducing mandatory 'Silly Walk Fridays'. Attendance is compulsory, unless you have a valid excuse... like being a surgeon currently performing brain surgery. Even then, maybe a quick 'Robot Rock' between incisions? Just kidding... mostly. Good luck to Dr. Chaturvedi. May his strides be silly and his tenure, long."
